title: Drawing, 1952–69
medium: Blue, brick red, dark green colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper fastened to cardboard with four staples
inscribed: Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 13
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Geometric patern of squares,  triangles and lines grouped in alternating small and large rows. Blue, red, green color repeat

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1952–69.
1952–69. Blue, brick red, dark green colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper fastened to cardboard with four staples. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-431.
